content.raw:
Looks really good to me. 

I think this is good to merge, but I want to have @caguero give it a quick look. 

Thank you for taking the time to do this - very nicely done.

content.raw:
Thank you for looking into it.

Perhaps using GetSimTime\(\) is better than using ros::Time::now\(\). Probably won’t make a big difference since the use\_sim\_time arg is true.
content.html:
Thank you for looking into it.

Perhaps using GetSimTime() is better than using ros::Time::now(). Probably won’t make a big difference since the use_sim_time arg is true.

content.raw:
I believe that World::GetSimTime\(\) has been replaced with World::SimTime\(\) for Gazebo 9.

From my understanding they are equivalent \(the Gazebo call or the ROS call\), but @caguero may have a stylistic preference.
content.html:
I believe that World::GetSimTime() has been replaced with World::SimTime() for Gazebo 9.

From my understanding they are equivalent (the Gazebo call or the ROS call), but @caguero may have a stylistic preference.

content.raw:
I'd recommend using the Gazebo time for not introducing a ROS dependency in this plugin. Keep in mind that you'll need to use an `ifdef` for supporting Gazebo 7 and Gazebo 9:

```
#if GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION >= 8
  this->prevUpdateTime = this->world->SimTime();
#else
  this->prevUpdateTime = this->world->GetSimTime();
#endif
```
content.html:
I'd recommend using the Gazebo time for not introducing a ROS dependency in this plugin. Keep in mind that you'll need to use an ifdef for supporting Gazebo 7 and Gazebo 9:

#if GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION >= 8
  this->prevUpdateTime = this->world->SimTime();
#else
  this->prevUpdateTime = this->world->GetSimTime();
#endif

content.raw: Could you update the documentation here describing the purpose of each SDF parameter?
content.html: Could you update the documentation here describing the purpose of each SDF parameter?

content.raw: Nitpick: I suggest to remove the `Var` prefix from all variable names. I'm assuming that this prefix means `variable`.
content.html: Nitpick: I suggest to remove the Var prefix from all variable names. I'm assuming that this prefix means variable.

content.raw: The variable here is describing the type of wind. As in: total wind = Variable wind \+ average wind, so I think stating Var is important.
content.html: The variable here is describing the type of wind. As in: total wind = Variable wind + average wind, so I think stating Var is important.

content.raw: Do you need to save the current time as a member variable? It seems that you can store it in `Update()` as a local variable.
content.html: Do you need to save the current time as a member variable? It seems that you can store it in Update() as a local variable.

content.raw: Do you need to save the current velocity as a member variable? It seems that you can store it in `Update()` as a local variable.
content.html: Do you need to save the current velocity as a member variable? It seems that you can store it in Update() as a local variable.

content.raw: I'd remove the `step` part. What we usually call `time step` is the entire range of time simulated in a single iteration. In this context, I think you mean `current time.`
content.html: I'd remove the step part. What we usually call time step is the entire range of time simulated in a single iteration. In this context, I think you mean current time.

content.raw: See my previous comment about removing `step`.
content.html: See my previous comment about removing step.

content.raw: See my previous comment about removing `step`.
content.html: See my previous comment about removing step.

content.raw: Could you also update the file `Changelog.md`?
content.html: Could you also update the file Changelog.md?

content.raw: You should be able to do `<< this->windDirection` directly.
content.html: You should be able to do << this->windDirection directly.

content.raw:
as in?

```
gzmsg << "Wind direction unit vector = " << this->windDirection <<
        << std::endl;
```

If  we do that, should we also change that for line 84?

```
  gzmsg << "Wind coefficient vector = " << windCoeff.X() << " , "
        << windCoeff.Y() << " , " << windCoeff.Z() << std::endl;
```

to be:

```
  gzmsg << "Wind coefficient vector = " << this->windCoeff << std::endl;
```
content.html:
as in?

gzmsg << "Wind direction unit vector = " << this->windDirection <<
        << std::endl;

If we do that, should we also change that for line 84?

  gzmsg << "Wind coefficient vector = " << windCoeff.X() << " , "
        << windCoeff.Y() << " , " << windCoeff.Z() << std::endl;

to be:

  gzmsg << "Wind coefficient vector = " << this->windCoeff << std::endl;

content.raw: Yes, we could update `this->windCoeff` too.
content.html: Yes, we could update this->windCoeff too.

content.raw: This is a tricky if we want to reproduce the exact same behavior among separate runs. Maybe we can expose the seed as an SDF parameter and the time can be the fallback option if the parameter is not set.
content.html: This is a tricky if we want to reproduce the exact same behavior among separate runs. Maybe we can expose the seed as an SDF parameter and the time can be the fallback option if the parameter is not set.
